keyword: how many calories in 1 fried egg
title: How Many Calories in 1 Fried Egg?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 1 fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in 1 Fried Egg?
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in a non-stick pan with minimal oil (1/2 tsp), no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, cooking fat used, pan type, and added ingredients. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg provides about 92 kcal and 6.3 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp butter instead of oil
Add 1 slice of cheese on top

faqs.q: How many calories in 1 fried egg?
faqs.a: Approximately 92 kcal for one large fried egg with minimal oil.

faqs.q: Is a fried egg higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added cooking fat; fried is ~92 kcal vs. ~78 kcal for boiled.

faqs.q: What are the macros for 1 fried egg?
faqs.a: About 6.3 g protein, 7 g fat, 0.4 g carbs.

faqs.q: Does the type of oil affect fried egg calories?
faqs.a: Yes; using more oil or butter increases fat and calories by 30-50 kcal per tsp.

faqs.q: How much cholesterol in 1 fried egg?
faqs.a: Around 185 mg, mostly from the yolk; frying doesn't significantly alter it.
